entry.title: I Knew You Were Trouble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "I Knew You Were Trouble" made Taylor Swift (pictured) the first artist to have two songs each sell over 400,000 digital copies within the first week of release in the U.S.?

entry.title: U Din Kyaw Khaung (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Konbaung-dynasty general U Din Kyaw Khaung was the only warrior said to have continued fighting after his death?

entry.title: Chestnut Centre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Chestnut Centre was the first place in the UK where giant otters were successfully bred in captivity?

entry.title: Ada Baker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Australian soprano Ada Baker toured India and China before becoming a singing teacher in Perth in 1889?

entry.title: 537 Votes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 537 Votes, documenting the controversial 2000 United States presidential election in Florida, was released in the run-up to the 2020 United States presidential election?

entry.title: Gemma Collis-McCann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Paralympian Gemma Collis-McCann, who sits on wheelchair fencing's new Gender Equity Commission, has been chosen to join three men as the UK's wheelchair fencing team in Tokyo?

entry.title: Port of Krueng Geukueh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Port of Krueng Geukueh in Aceh, Indonesia, became an entry point for aid shipments as it was not damaged by the 2004 tsunami?

entry.title: Mama Cheung (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one of Hong Kong YouTuber Mama Cheung's most viewed videos shows her using a rice cooker to bake a cake?
